name: Sundowner Motel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sundowner for our mini vacation last week. The room was big and clean, the front desk was helpful at figuring out what we needed (with two toddlers). The pools were nice (the kiddie one is like 4 square feet but was actually perfect), and the beach was clean. Small, but we were the only family using it so that was fine. Great views of the MinniHaha and parasailers.
reviews.title: Clean, Lakeside, Fine for Families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking is a little tricky, but that is more the fault of the location than the hotel on an incline.
reviews.title: Clean Room, Good Value, Private Beach, Walking Distance to Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One complaint: I wish the whole property was non smoking, not just the rooms. Every time we were outside I felt like someone was smoking next to me. On the beach, in the pool area, in the picnic area. But that's coming from a nonsmoker.
reviews.title: Once Again An AWESOME Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few odd bits: The closet floor was half done, the tiling in the bathroom was missing grout in a corner, and next to our room was an odd, open cement garage. Not sure what itspurpose was, but we found it funny.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location

reviews.text: There were kayaks up for grabs and we saw lots of families taking advantage of that. We would try if the kids were older.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay

reviews.text: We have been coming to the Lake George area with friends and family for almost 25 years, and we are so glad we found this great place!Clean, quiet property. close to the village and shopping: It really is a perfect spot, and we are already looking forward to next year!
reviews.title: Lovely property, on the lake

reviews.text: Nice, clean affordable rooms. Nice pool and beach area. Easy to walk into village. Would definitely consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Would stay here again.

reviews.text: We were at the Sundowner for 2 nights and we had a great time. Location was excellent, rooms were clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great motel located on the shores of Lake George. Located downtown and close to restaurants and shopping. Clean rooms on a tiered setting with great pool and hot tub with views of mountains and lake. Rooms have fridges and microwaves. Lots of parking. Did not use WiFi.
reviews.title: On the Lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: prices were good, hostesses could be more friendly. pool, beach and kayaks were good and available. been here several times and always enjoyed. stay away from room 102 (room from hell). still had a great time and will return some day.
reviews.title: good and bad

reviews.text: We met the owners and they helped us out of a jamb. what beautiful people and what a clean place. Thanks, you salvaged our vacation. Kevin and Noreen.
reviews.title: Met the owners, what beautiful people and what a clean place. Thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I stayed in the lakeview housekeeping cabin. The cabin was big enough to hold five people (the fifth person would stay on a sleeper couch in front of the TV). Furnished kitchen, great refrigerator, nice micro, has coffeepot (I never touch motel c'makers). It was pretty clean and the walls had that Adirondack look (knotty pine). Has AC and baseboard heating. Beds quite comfy. Parking very cramped. Loved the access to beach - provided a great sunrise. The only thing I would suggest that you bring a sheet to cover the couch or that the owners clean the thing - I detected a funny sort of unidentiable off-odor emanating from it - just don't set your plain duffs on it. View of lake is quite limited from this cabin and if you want a great view, ask for room #209 or one of the two lakefront rooms with sliding doors on the end. I gave highest rating for service because staff came down to personally help with a plumbing problem otherwise since it was the end of the season, the female clerk seemed tired and ready to go on vacation herself!
reviews.title: Pretty good, would return again.

reviews.text: We were very happy staying at the Sundowner for 2 nights on September 18th and 19th, for the 2009 Jazz Festival of Lake George.
reviews.title: A Great Stay at the Sundowner Motel

reviews.text: The location of this hotel couldn't be better. It's on Canada Street, directly on the lake, with it's own small beach and free boat rental, and it's a pleasant walk into the Village, where all of the action is. (wax museums, arcades, golf, restaurants, little shops etc.) It's interesting to note that most of the motels are in a row like dominos. Though their prices all vary, from the outside they all tend to look similar. Prior to this trip, I had price checked for value, and The Sundowner had one of the lowest prices, it also had some of the best reviews. Bear in mind that these Lake George motels are country type motels, without porters, valet parking, room service and huge fancy lobbies. If that's what you are looking for, you'd better look further! If what you want is a decent sized clean room in a convenient but safe/quiet area, at an affordable price, you'll be happy here.
reviews.title: Nice motel, enjoyed our stay.

reviews.text: We had a ground floor room (which is actually up a very short flight of stairs) directly across from the pool, with a side view of the lake. We parked directly in front of our room! I paid $79.00 a night, and it was really worth the price. The room was surprisingly large, and it had 2 queen sized beds, a comfy chair, a couch, as well as a dining room table with 4 chairs. (great for playing boardgames and cards, besides just eating there) There was a 27" tv with cable.(important if traveling with teenagers!). There was a small fridge, but no coffee maker. There are plently of dresser drawers for clothes, as well as a decent sized closet. The beds were very comfortable, not too mushy, not too hard either. The sheets were soft, and we slept like babies! The room was very clean, and the lighting was good. (important to me, I don't like dimly lit motel rooms) There was plenty of space for me and my 2 teenagers.
reviews.title: Bad first impression

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased with our experience. Our room was very clean and spacious. It a had a huge bathroom with 2 sinks. My husband and I could get ready without stepping on each others toes! The hotel offers free kayaks for 2 hour rentals. It is about a 15-minute walk to the attractions on Canada Street. I will stay here again on my next visit.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a weekend in Lake George, this hotel met and exceeded my criteria for cleanliness, cost, and location. You can park your car and not need it for the whole weekend. Loved it and the staff was very friendly and courteous. Will definitely go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful Visit

reviews.text: It is a very nice motel directly on Lake George. You will not find a cleaner place. Our room was just redone with a brand new bath vanity , tub, carpet and bed. It is close enough to walk to the restaurants and the cruise paddle boats without paying for parking in town. It is also nice to go to the clubs at night without driving home. I can't wait to stay there again and enjoy Lake George.
reviews.title: Family owned and very clean

reviews.text: This is mine and my family's fourth year in a row staying at the Sundowner Motel in fabulous Lake George. We first found it on a whim, and have been back ever since. Jeff and Anna (the owners) are amazing... always out making the property better...you can absolutely tell that this is family owned and operated. It's a great place to stay with a family (I have a 3.5 year old)... It has the perfectly sized private beach for a little one... not too big to get lost in a crowd, but not too small as to be able to enjoy it. They have kayaks and a row boat to rent for free on a first come first serve basis. And, even though this motel is centrally located to all the hustle and bustle of downtown lake George, it is quiet. When you come home you can sleep! The rooms are modern yet affordable, and always clean. 4 years and counting... I will definitely be back.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Lake George

reviews.text: this is the second year we stayed at this hotel on the same weekend..stayed at other places n this is my favorite..rooms are very clean...pool is heated n very clean....owners n staff r freindly n helpful...
reviews.title: great hotel /great price/friendly staff
Great location... Lots of smoke
reviews.text: We stayed here last year and had a great experience. This year I should have known to be concerned when I asked about getting a room on the end so if our toddlers took a bit to go to bed we wouldnt disturb others, and was told "we'd better not get calls." um, family friendly?

We checked in, great clean room, hard parking situation, went out to town. Came back two hours later and the four adults in the room next to us we're in camping chairs lining the path to our room, smoking, with one empty case of beer and another being worked on. Seemed like everyone in the hotel was smoking outside. Not quite the non-smoking family hotel we had last year.
reviews.title: my favorite getaway

reviews.text: That said, the drinkers didn't keep us up, nor did our boys have any issues going to bed. Loved the small beach.
reviews.title: A great deal!

reviews.text: I'm on the fence for our next trip, might seek out a true smoke-free hotel.
reviews.title: Definitely would stay at Sundowner again

reviews.text: i've been going to Lake George all my life and have stayed at over half a dozen places and i always go back to the sundowner. it can be tempting to stay at some of the larger resorts close by but you will always end up paying more and contend with larger crowds. at the sundowner, they have the most reasonable prices for what they offer, and you never feel like the other guests are right on top of you. the owners and staff are wonderful. family owned and run and they make sure you are happy with your stay...they even remember your name which goes a long way in making a guest feel welcome. this is an old school motel, which still uses keyed entries instead of the electronic key cards and some of the rooms have a wonderful cabin-like feel (i always request the wood paneled rooms..so retro!). as for amenities, they offer a nice sized heated pool with ample sun space, not to mention a nice sun deck off the pool, as well as one of the largest private beaches with even more sun space. the lake stays very shallow for a good 100 feet from the beach so that makes hanging in the lake that much more enjoyable. one of the nicest touches are the free kayak (there are 4 available) and row boat rentals. not a bad idea to supply your own life vest as the super old school orange vests provided aren't comfortable for anything, but that is hardly a complaint against the motel. ample parking and clean rooms with excellent housekeeping and more than adequate bathroom and sink space. bedding could be more comfortable but you aren't trying to stay in bed all day so it's a minor complaint. also the towels are not so friendly to sunburn so not the worst idea to bring a towel or two. motel also offers laundry use, an ice machine and microwave. although it is one of the last motels on the strip, it is still only a short walk from the village and you can hop back onto 87 with a simple right turn off the property..and it is next to the Tamarack Inn for decent steak and seafood in a rustic dining. overall, i love staying here. wonderful staff and very well maintained. i'll always go back to the sundowner!
reviews.title: The best stay on the lake

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Sundowner Motel for six nights. Everything about the room was great--except housekeeping.
reviews.title: Good value, big rooms, good location, not very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: Large, comfortable room with refrigerator, relatively clean carpeting (don't you hate that sticky feeling?), gigantic bathroom with two sinks, newer bathroom fixtures. The lighting in the room was abundant (a pet peeve of mine). The view from our room couldn't be beat, and we had a large patio. The motel is located near the end of the downtown, with an easy walk to all the good restaurants. The owners are friendly and helpful, and if we needed anything it was handled right away.
reviews.title: Clean , Comfortable and Convienient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: I'm pretty sure the shelves in our bathroom had never been wiped down, and we actually wondered if the bathtub had ever been cleaned (even though the tub was green, we could see the dirt). There were candy wrappers under one of the side tables from previous guests. Our room was not vacuumed once while we were there. We had to ask for tissues and TP. While the towels were old and thin (someone with long hair might need three towels to get dry hair), they were adequate. The sheets were pilled but, again, adequate. My matress was on the verge of needing replacement because it felt like I was sleeping on a big "V" and kept rolling into the middle.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend this motel because the only real problem was the cleanliness (but it was a big one).
reviews.title: Super Clean Fair rates Excellent owner/management We loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a fall getaway to the adirondacks area. After lots of time looking around on the internet chose this motel. The room while on the small side ( we stayed in a lakeside queen) was very clean and comfortable. The location was ideal, easy walk to town . I would recommend this motel and if we are back in Lake George will stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very nice family-owned hotel. Always friendly and helpful. Rooms are modern and clean. Area was quiet though located right on the main street and despite having a bridal party revelers and some motorcycle couples staying there too :) Shops and restaurants were closeby and walkable. Parking spots were a little tight especially since we have a pick-up truck. Hotel offers free kayak rentals to use right from their private beach that we took advantage of. We did have a toilet clog but they fixed it before we got back to our room. Price reasonable. Weren't able to use pool since it closed for the season but sure looked nice. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Sundowner is a Thumbs Upper!

reviews.text: Stayed in Lake George overnight on way to New Hampshire. Family run motel, very friendly owners. Big room with spectacular view of Lake George. Definitely will return next summer for a longer stay.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean and spacious room and well priced.

reviews.text: always loved the sundowner and always will !!! very nice owners now, had so much fun last weekend, juccuzi is great every thing is clean, i was going way back , when the pool was at the top , beatiful memory's every yr !!!
reviews.title: been staying since i was a kid, and every yr since with my grandkids now !!! great place on the lake

description: The Sundowner Motel is conveniently located in Lake George Village directly on the shores of beautiful Lake George. We are a short walk from shops, restaurants, and activities in the village. Enjoy our clean, comfortable motel rooms, wonderful views of the lake, surrounding mountains and the other amenities that we offer:-Outdoor Heated Pool-Outdoor Kiddie Pool-Outdoor Deck overlooking Lake George-Outdoor Whirlpool-Free use of kayaks and rowboat-Free Wi-Fi-Private, shallow sandy beach-Picnic Tables and charcoal grills near beach-Laundromat-Free AM Coffee-All of our units are now non-smoking!
